abstract: The government has told the bank that it needs the capital to withstand any worsening of the economic downturn, according to an executive at the bank.
snippet: The government has told the bank that it needs the capital to withstand any worsening of the economic downturn, according to an executive at the bank.
lead_paragraph: The government has told Bank of America it needs $33.9 billion in capital to withstand any worsening of the economic downturn, according to an executive at the bank.

headline.main: Bank of America Needs $33.9 Billion, U.S. Says
headline.print_headline: U.S. Telling Bank of America It Needs $34 Billion Cushion

byline.original: By Louise Story and Eric Dash

abstract: The government has told Bank of America it needs $33.9 billion in capital to withstand any worsening of the economic downturn, The New York Times’s Louise Story and Eric Dash reported, citing an executive at the bank.
lead_paragraph: The government has told Bank of America it needs $33.9 billion in capital to withstand any worsening of the economic downturn, The New York Times’s Louise Story and Eric Dash reported, citing an executive at the bank.

headline.main: U.S. Says BofA Needs $33.9 Billion Cushion

abstract: Bank of America could soon sell shares in China’s second-largest bank that could raise about a quarter of the $34 billion in added capital it is reported to need after a government stress test, Reuters reported.
lead_paragraph: Bank of America could soon sell shares in China’s second-largest bank that could raise about a quarter of the $34 billion in added capital it is reported to need after a government stress test, Reuters reported.

headline.main: Will Bank of America Sell Part of China Bank Stake?

abstract: Why is Bank of America‘s stock rising today? While $34 billion is a big number, some on Wall Street thought its capital shortfall would be twice as large.
snippet: Why is Bank of America‘s stock rising today? While $34 billion is a big number, some on Wall Street thought its capital shortfall would be twice as large.
lead_paragraph: In normal times, news that a company needed $34 billion in extra capital would be disastrous. Yet shares of Bank of America were on the upswing Wednesday morning after reports that regulators wanted the company to increase its capital by that amount, to cushion against more economic shocks.

headline.main: For BofA, It Could Have Been Worse
